item.description:
[Note: Date moved to October 1, to not conflict with a Bardo party on 9/24]

 

We have been having a great group of new members coming to our bi-weekly Portsmouth and Dover social meetups. But those venues can be too small and cramp for everyone to get to meet and talk to each other.

So to allow all our members, old and new, to meet and get acquainted or to reconnect, we are having our annual fall party Saturday October 1 at the Puterbaugh freehold.

And we are going to revive the chowder competition that we had a few years back. Please feel free to bring a chowder dish to enter into the competition. Clam, seafood, corn, whatever. It's all good! Or bring a another dish to share, if you are not into chowder or you want something to eat outside of the chowder food group.

Gates open at 4:00 PM. Vote counting happens promptly at 6:30 (but the party will go on until ???)

There will be a bonfire [bring your own chair, if possible] and outdoor games [cornhole, etc]. Musical instruments welcome.

This is a family friendly event. Kids and dogs are welcome and encouraged.

Closing time is whenever the last ember dies out.

Hope to see you all there.

-Todd
item.name: Seacoast Liberty Fall Party & Chowder Cookoff
